info.headline: Hard Freeze Watch issued December 21 at 2:04AM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...HARD FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Prolonged sub-freezing temperatures expected. Temperatures will remain below freezing for for much of the time period, with overnight low temperatures ranging from 10 to 20 degrees across most of the area. * WHERE...Portions of central, south central, southwest and west central Louisiana and southeast Texas. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
